meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of an echo.
meanings.sent1: The echoic sound bounced off the walls of the canyon.
meanings.sent2: The room had an echoic quality that made every noise seem louder.
meanings.sent3: The echoic laughter of the children filled the playground with joy.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had an echoic effect, resonating through the empty hallways.
meanings.sent5: The echoic nature of the cave made it a perfect spot for acoustics enthusiasts.

meanings.sent1: The echoic painting created the illusion of depth on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The echoic design of the building made it look like it had multiple layers.
meanings.sent3: The echoic pattern on the fabric seemed to repeat itself endlessly.
meanings.sent4: Her dress had an echoic effect, making her stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The echoic colors of the sunset reflected beautifully on the water.

meanings.sent1: The echoic chamber was designed to test sound reflections.
meanings.sent2: The echoic microphone picked up even the faintest of sounds.
meanings.sent3: The echoic room made it difficult to have a quiet conversation.
meanings.sent4: His shout in the canyon was met with an echoic response.
meanings.sent5: The echoic effect of the mountains made the landscape even more majestic.
